plants.name: Dinner Plate Aralia
plants.description: Dinner Plate Aralia Plant (Dinner Plate Fatsia) is a tropical shrub native to Asia and is also known by the scientific name Fatsia japonica. It is prized for its large, glossy green leaves that can grow up to a foot in diameter. The leaves are shaped like a dinner plate and are the reason for its common name.
plants.care_instruction: The Dinner Plate Aralia Plant is easy to care for and requires minimal maintenance. It is important to keep the soil moist but not waterlogged. The plant also requires regular feeding with a balanced fertilizer. It is also important to prune the plant regularly to maintain its shape and size.

plants.name: Spider Plant Variegtaed
plants.description: A native of Africa.Its ease of growing makes it a favorite plant with beginners. Grows up to 40 cms high.Leaves are long grassy about 3 to 4 cms wide and up to 30 cms long.Small white flowers are held on long arching stalks. They are followed by a tuft of young plantlets.Its use as a house plant originated centuries ago. Has been certified by NASA as one of the best removers of indoor pollutants. So is a plant very much relevant today - and will remain in the future!
plants.light_requirement: Sun growing, Semi shade, Shade growing
plants.care_instruction: - It is very hardy grows.Very dependable.Any good soil with compost added is fine.Tolerates heat as well as cold quite well.

plants.name: Lavender
plants.description: Lavender is a fragrant herb known for its calming properties and beautiful purple flowers.Despite its Mediterranean origin, English lavender was so named because it grows well in that country's cooler climate and has long been a staple in English herb gardens. The gray-green foliage and whorls of tiny flowers make this one of the most attractive lavenders in the garden. It’s one of the most cold-hardy varieties and the best for culinary use because of its low camphor content
plants.care_instruction:
1. Place the lavender plant in a sunny location with well-draining soil.
2. Water the plant deeply but infrequently, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.
3. Trim back the plant after flowering to maintain its shape and encourage new growth.
4. Avoid over-fertilizing the lavender plant to prevent excessive foliage growth.
5. Prune the plant in early spring to remove any dead or woody stems.

plants.name: Ficus
plants.description: Ficus plants, also known as weeping figs, are popular houseplants with glossy leaves and a graceful appearance.
plants.care_instruction:
1. Place the ficus plant in a well-lit area away from direct sunlight.
2. Water the plant when the top inch of soil feels dry, but avoid overwatering.
3. Mist the leaves occasionally to increase humidity.
4. Fertilize the plant every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.
5. Prune the ficus to maintain its desired size and shape, especially in spring.

plants.name: Money tree
plants.description: We’re just as disappointed this isn’t the Sims’ money tree 🤑, but IRL the money tree is a symbol of positive energy, luck, and prosperity. Who doesn’t want that?
plants.light_requirement: Bright, indirect lights. Thrives in fluorescent lighting (perfect for apartment living).
plants.water_requirement: Water when the soil is almost completely dry at top.
plants.care_instruction: Choosing the Right Location: Find a spot with bright, indirect sunlight. Avoid direct sunlight, as it can scorch the leaves.Selecting a Pot and Soil: Choose a well-draining pot with drainage holes and use a well-aerated, peat-based potting mix.Propagation: Propagate your plant using stem cuttings placed in water or soil. Roots should appear within a few weeks

plants.name: Mophead Hydrangea
plants.description: Hydrangea macrophylla, also known as bigleaf hydrangea or French hydrangea, is a popular flowering shrub native to Japan and Korea. It is widely grown for its large, showy blooms that come in a variety of colors, including pink, blue, purple, and white. Here is some information about growing, caring for, and the benefits of hydrangea macrophylla plants:
plants.light_requirement: Plant hydrangea macrophylla in a location with partial shade or filtered sunlight, as full sun can cause the leaves to wilt and the flowers to fade quickly.
plants.water_requirement: Water regularly, especially during hot, dry weather, to keep the soil moist but not waterlogged.
plants.care_instruction: To encourage large, showy blooms, consider adding aluminum sulfate to the soil to lower the pH and make it more acidic. This will help the plant absorb aluminum, which is necessary for blue flower coloration.Hydrangea macrophylla can be susceptible to a variety of pests and diseases, including aphids, spider mites, powdery mildew, and leaf spot. Regular monitoring and treatment can help prevent and control these issues.

plants.name: Hydrangea Hybrids
plants.description: - What we recognize as hydrangea flowers are actually sepals. (like in ixoras, poinsettia, bougainvillea etc).The sepals are long lasting.There are hundreds of varieties of Hydrangeas. Pictures shown are some of them.The hydrangea is a very showy medium compact deciduous shrub.Flowers heads are very attractive.Flowers spread like a sheet all around the top and the sides and seem to smother the leaves.Very popular all over the world as a indoor as well as garden plant.The color of the flower indicates soil pH. Acidic soils make the color pink and alkaline soils make the color pink
plants.care_instruction: - Hydrangeas can take full sunlight in mild climates. In areas with very hot and dry summers - it is advisable to protect them from harsh afternoon sunlight.Plants require good fertile, well drained soil with a lot of organic matter in it.Water regularly - expecially in summer.Can be grown in pots as well as ground

plants.name: Black Dragon
plants.description: The Bunny Ears Opuntia Microdasys is a type of cactus that is native to Mexico. It gets its name from its distinctive, round pads that resemble bunny ears. This cactus is slow-growing, but relatively easy to care for.
plants.care_instruction: The plant should be watered only when the soil has completely dried out. Over-watering can cause root rot. The Bunny Ears Opuntia Microdasys is also relatively resistant to pests and disease.

plants.name: Ophiopogon Black
plants.description: Ophiopogon planiscapus is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is a small evergreen perennial growing to 20 cm (8 in) tall by 30 cm (12 in)wide. It grows from short rhizomes, and bears tufts of grasslike leaves, from which purple or white flowers emerge in racemes held on short stems above the leaves. It is native to Japan, where it grows on open and forested slopes.
plants.care_instruction: - Is frustratingly slow growing.Will stay in the same pots for decades!Have patience - get this plant - it really tests it.Otherwise it is fairly easy to grow.

plants.name: Birdnest Philodendron
plants.description: Philodendron ‘Autumn’ is a hybrid self-heading Philodendron. Rather than a climbing vine, the self heading type of Philodendron grows on upright stems that do not need support. Philodendron ‘Autumn’ in recent years has become a popular houseplant due to it’s pretty foliage. The new leaves emerge in colors of bronze and gold and fade to green upon maturing.
plants.light_requirement: Semi shade, Shade growing, Low light tolerant
plants.care_instruction: Grows well at warm temperatures and in high humidity. They like bright light but not direct sunlight. The soil HAS to be well drained. If they are being put in pots - arranging a few broken pot pieces at the bottom will aid in drainage. Adding sand in potting mix is also a good idea.When planted with ferns and other plants - the plants enjoy themselves. - Philodendrons are plants from the tropical jungles.

plants.name: Philodendron Wendlandii
plants.description: - Plants have a rosette of thick, waxy green, long obovate leaves with thick midrib, arranged like a birds - nest.The short petioles are spongy, spathe cream white.These are philodendrons with stout small stems. They are quite slow growing.The leaves are held closely together. They do form stems - but it takes many many years.Plants are medium growth and therefore do not require trimming.Plants form nice, compact and full specimens.
plants.light_requirement: Semi shade, Shade growing, Low light tolerant
plants.care_instruction: Grows well at warm temperatures and in high humidity. They like bright light but not direct sunlight. The soil HAS to be well drained. If they are being put in pots - arranging a few broken pot pieces at the bottom will aid in drainage. Adding sand in potting mix is also a good idea.When planted with ferns and other plants - the plants enjoy themselves. - Philodendrons are plants from the tropical jungles.

plants.name: Philodendron Cardinal
plants.description: Plants have a rosette of thick, waxy green, long obovate leaves with thick midrib, arranged like a birds - nest.The short petioles are spongy, spathe cream white.These are philodendrons with stout small stems. They are quite slow growing.The leaves are held closely together. They do form stems - but it takes many many years.Plants are medium growth and therefore do not require trimming.Plants form nice, compact and full specimens.
plants.care_instruction: A minimum of 30 cms or larger pots should be used for growing this variety.Grows well at warm temperatures and in high humidity. They like bright light but not direct sunlight. The soil HAS to be well drained. If they are being grown in pots - arranging a few broken pot pieces at the bottom will aid in drainage. Adding sand in potting mix is also a good idea.

plants.name: Syngonium
plants.description: - Elegant appearance leaves many sagittate, velvety, deep green, mid-vein contrasting white.A showy pot plant.Syngoniums are native of central and tropical America and the West Indies.Leaves arrow shaped on long, straight stem.They are versatile shade plants.Newer hybrids do not develop a stem quickly and form a clump of leaves in the pots.Pots look very full and attractive for indoor and shade decoration.Can be used as a groundcover and for mixed plantings.
plants.care_instruction: Syngoniums like other climbing aroids, prefer warm moist atmosphere and a support on damp moss.They prefer bright light for better and attractive colour but not direct sun.Plants prefer humid growing conditions.The require water - especially on very hot days.They have better leaf color and compact growth in bright light.

plants.name: Money Plant Golden
plants.description: Golden Money Plant, also known as Epipremnum aureum or Pothos, is a popular indoor plant known for its stunning golden variegated leaves and low-maintenance requirements. This guide will provide you with detailed instructions on how to grow, care for, and enjoy the benefits of your Golden Money Plant.
plants.water_requirement: Water the plant when the top inch of soil feels dry. Over-watering can cause root rot.
plants.care_instruction: Choosing the Right Location: Find a spot with bright, indirect sunlight. Avoid direct sunlight, as it can scorch the leaves.Selecting a Pot and Soil: Choose a well-draining pot with drainage holes and use a well-aerated, peat-based potting mix.Propagation: Propagate your plant using stem cuttings placed in water or soil. Roots should appear within a few weeks.

plants.name: Echeveria
plants.description: Echeveria is a large genus of flowering plants in the family Crassulaceae, native to semi-desert areas of Central America, Mexico and northwestern South America.Plants may be evergreen or deciduous. Flowers on short stalks (cymes) arise from compact rosettes of succulent fleshy, often brightly coloured leaves.[2] Species are polycarpic, meaning that they may flower and set seed many times over the course of their lifetimes. Often numerous offsets are produced, and are commonly known as 'hen and chicks', which can also refer to other genera, such as Sempervivum, that are significantly different from Echeveria. Many species of Echeveria serve important environmental roles, such as those of host plants for butterflies. For example, the butterfly Callophrys xami uses several species of Echeveria, such as Echevelia gibbiflora, for suitable host plants. Even more, these plants are integral to the oviposition process of C. xami and some other butterfly species as well
plants.light_requirement: avoid these two things: drastic sunlight changes and summer afternoon full sun
plants.water_requirement: Pour on the water until it drains out the bottom. Repeat this a couple times
plants.care_instruction: Echeveria like full sun. However, try to avoid these two things: drastic sunlight changes and summer afternoon full sun. When you water Echeveria, water the soil and not the rosette. Pour on the water until it drains out the bottom. Repeat this a couple times. Then don’t water again until the soil has dried out. You don’t want your plant to remain soaking wet all the time. To help prevent this, don’t let the pot sit in a saucer full of water. Like all succulents, Echeveria need soil that drains quickly. This helps prevent moisture from rotting the roots.

plants.name: Big Schefflera Hicolor
plants.description: - Highly variegted, vigorous and quick growing.This is a medium leaf schefflera. By medium we mean that its leaves are larger than the schfflera arboricola and smaller than the Brassia actinophylla.Its growth is similar to the arboricola.Plants can be variously grown. As indoor plants, as plants in shade or as plants in full sunlight.Grows over 4 to 5 meters tall. Rather hapazard growing. Needs trimming to keep in shape.
plants.care_instruction: - This is a versatile indoor as well as an outdoor plant.Requires minimum care.Good well drained soils are fine.Will grow in full sunlight in high humidity and areas with mild summers. Will grow in shade everywhere.Is a tropical plant that likes warm temperatures.

plants.name: Yucca Silver
plants.description: The Yucca Silver plant is a member of the Agavaceae family and is native to the arid regions of Mexico and the southwestern United States. It is a slow-growing, evergreen shrub that is known for its striking silver leaves and dramatic spikes of white flowers.
plants.water_requirement: Only water full water is dried
plants.care_instruction: Yucca Silver plants are drought tolerant and require little water, making them ideal for low-maintenance gardens. Watering should be limited to once a week, or even less frequently during prolonged periods of drought. If the plant is grown in a container, it should be repotted every 2-3 years to ensure proper growth. Pruning should be done in the spring to remove any dead leaves and stems.

plants.name: Law's Barleria
plants.scientific_name: Acanthaceae or Crossandra or Thunbergia family
plants.description: Barleria lawii is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India, where it grows in moist, evergreen forests at elevations up to 1,500 meters. The plant has large, ovate leaves and produces clusters of showy, purple flowers that bloom in the rainy season. It is often grown as an ornamental plant in gardens and parks, and is valued for its attractive flowers and ability to attract butterflies.
plants.water_requirement: Normal, Can tolerate less, Can tolerate more
plants.care_instruction: Barleria lawii plants have a number of benefits. They are attractive ornamental plants that can add color and interest to gardens and landscapes. Their purple flowers are particularly attractive to butterflies, making them a good choice for gardens that attract pollinators. In addition, the plants are low-maintenance and easy to care for, making them suitable for both novice and experienced gardeners. They are also drought-tolerant and can thrive in a range of soil types, making them a good choice for dry or difficult-to-maintain areas.

plants.name: Shrimp Plant Yellow
plants.scientific_name: Acanthaceae or Crossandra or Thunbergia family
plants.description: Pachystachys lutea, commonly known as the Yellow Shrimp Plant, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a fast-growing, shrubby plant with a height of up to 2-3 feet tall and wide. The plant is well known for its bright yellow, cone-shaped bracts that grow along the stem and attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.
plants.water_requirement: regular watering, especially during the warm and dry seasons
plants.care_instruction: Pachystachys lutea needs regular watering, especially during the warm and dry seasons. The plant does not tolerate drought conditions and will wilt if the soil is too dry. It also needs to be fertilized regularly with a balanced fertilizer to promote healthy growth and blooming. Pruning may be necessary to keep the plant from becoming too tall and leggy, and it should be done after the blooming period.

plants.name: Radiator Plant
plants.description: One of the larger leaved Pepromia. The leaves are waxy and leathery.The veins stand out against the bluish green foliage.The leaves shine and show off well
plants.care_instruction: As with most pepromias this is generally grown in containers. Because of its fairly large size and spreading habit it can be grown well in large size hanging baskets.

plants.name: Burrows Tail
plants.description: - Tear shaped leaves1 to 1.5 inch thick,1.5 to 3 feet longYellow green leaves1.5 inch deep rose colored flower3 inch-2 feet tall, trailing stems 3 feet longA pretty ucculent trailer of compact habit, the wiry stems dense with long thin greenish glaucescent 2.5 to 3 cms long leaves having pointed tips, very sturdy and durable.Best grown in pots or protected raised beds.
plants.care_instruction: - Plants grow best in bright light. In shade they grow lanky. In full sun they may get scorched.They like a very well draining potting mix which should contain at least 33% sand.Bone meal fertilizer is good for them.The soil should be kept dry. Take care that the plants are not flooded during the monsoon.Best grown in pots - especially in high rainfall areas.The leaves and stems are delicate and break if the plants are handled roughly. Be careful

plants.name: Alocasia Amazonica
plants.description: The plant bears many dark green leaves with white veins and margins. It is a hybrid of Alocasia sanderiana X alocasin lowii grandis. Stem is thick, rhizomatous, densely marked with leaf scars. Plants develop many leaves and a well grown plant is a treat for the eyes.
plants.care_instruction: Grows best in soil mixed with a minimum of 50 percent organic matter. Prefer a moist and shady situation. It grows well in porous soil, rich in organic matter, perfect drainage is absolutely necessary. Propagated by the division of rhizome, suckers and more recently tissue culture.

plants.name: Alocasia Amazonica
plants.description: The plant bears many dark green leaves with white veins and margins. It is a hybrid of Alocasia sanderiana X alocasin lowii grandis. Stem is thick, rhizomatous, densely marked with leaf scars. Plants develop many leaves and a well grown plant is a treat for the eyes.
plants.care_instruction: Grows best in soil mixed with a minimum of 50 percent organic matter. Prefer a moist and shady situation. It grows well in porous soil, rich in organic matter, perfect drainage is absolutely necessary. Propagated by the division of rhizome, suckers and more recently tissue culture.

plants.name: Aglaonema Pink Anyamanee
plants.description: Aglaonema Anyamanee Pink is a popular ornamental houseplant that is native to Southeast Asia. It is prized for its attractive foliage, which is a bright shade of pink with green veins and edges. The plant grows up to 2 feet tall and spreads 2-3 feet wide.
plants.care_instruction: Aglaonema Anyamanee Pink requires minimal care and is a low maintenance plant. It is important to provide the plant with adequate humidity, as it is native to a tropical climate. To increase humidity, you can mist the plant regularly or place a humidifier near it. The plant also needs to be fertilized every 2-3 months during the growing season to encourage healthy growth

plants.name: Aglaonema Red Valentine
plants.description: Aglaonema red valentine is a tropical plant that is native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araceae family and is also known as the Chinese Evergreen. This plant has dark green leaves that are patterned with red or pink markings. The leaves are elongated and have a glossy appearance, making them a great addition to any home or office.
plants.care_instruction: This plant is very low maintenance and can be easily cared for. It should be watered when the soil is slightly dry to the touch, but be careful not to over-water. Fertilize once a month with a balanced, water-soluble fertilizer. Keep the plant away from direct sunlight and in a location with good air circulation.

plants.name: Aglaonema Prestige
plants.description: Aglaonema Prestige has a number of benefits, including its ability to purify the air. It is also known to help reduce stress and improve indoor air quality. This plant is also low-maintenance, making it a great choice for those who want an attractive plant in their home without the hassle of constant care.
plants.water_requirement: Normal,Do not let the soil become waterlogged
plants.care_instruction: Aglaonema Prestige requires minimal care and is a low-maintenance plant. Water the plant when the top inch of soil is dry. Do not let the soil become waterlogged, as this can lead to root rot. It is also important to keep the plant away from direct sunlight, as it may cause scorching of the leaves. Fertilize the plant with a balanced liquid fertilizer once a month during the growing season.

plants.name: Cereus Repandus
plants.description: Cereus repandus, commonly known as the night-blooming cereus, is a species of cactus native to the Southwestern United States and Mexico. It is a large, branching, cactus that grows up to 20 feet tall and produces large, fragrant, white flowers that bloom at night.
plants.care_instruction: This cactus requires well-drained soil and a sunny location.Water the plant only when the soil is completely dry.During the winter months, reduce watering to once a month.Fertilize the plant once a month during the growing season with a balanced, water-soluble fertilizer.

plants.name: Night-blooming Cereus
plants.description: Cereus Peruvianus Paolina, also known as Peruvian Apple Cactus or Night-blooming Cereus, is a fast-growing columnar cactus native to South America. This plant is characterized by its ribbed, spiny columns, large nocturnal blooms, and edible fruit. It can make a stunning addition to any cactus garden, landscape, or indoor plant collection.
plants.care_instruction: Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and encourage branchingPest control: Monitor for mealybugs, scale insects, and spider mitesWinter protection: Move indoors or provide frost protection in colder climates

plants.name: Ferocactus Plant
plants.description: Ferocactus, also known as barrel cactus, is a genus of large, ribbed, and spiny cacti native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. These plants are known for their striking appearance, drought tolerance, and low-maintenance needs, making them an ideal choice for arid gardens and indoor environments.
plants.care_instruction: Choosing the right location: Ferocactus thrive in full sun and well-draining soil. Select a sunny spot in your garden, or place indoor plants near a south-facing window.Soil preparation: Use a cactus or succulent mix or create your own by combining equal parts potting soil, perlite, and coarse sand.Planting: Dig a hole slightly larger than the root ball, place the plant in the hole, and gently backfill with the soil mixture. Ensure the crown of the plant is level with the soil surface.

plants.name: Echeveria
plants.description: Echeveria is a large genus of flowering plants in the stonecrop family Crassulaceae, native to semi-desert areas of Central America, Mexico, and northwestern South America. Plants may be evergreen or deciduous. Flowers on short stalks (cymes) arise from compact rosettes of succulent fleshy, often brightly colored leaves. These species are polycarpic, meaning that they may flower and set seed many times over the course of their lifetimes. Often numerous offsets are produced and are commonly known as 'hen and chicks', which can also refer to other genera, such as Sempervivum, that are significantly different from Echeveria. Many species of Echeveria serve important environmental roles, such as those of host plants for butterflies.
plants.water_requirement: Pour on the water until it drains out the bottom
plants.care_instruction: Echeveria like full sun. However, try to avoid these two things: drastic sunlight changes and summer afternoon full sun. When you water Echeveria, water the soil and not the rosette. Pour on the water until it drains out the bottom. Repeat this a couple times. Then don’t water again until the soil has dried out. You don’t want your plant to remain soaking wet all the time. To help prevent this, don’t let the pot sit in a saucer full of water. Like all succulents, Echeveria need soil that drains quickly. This helps prevent moisture from rotting the roots.

plants.name: Zygo Cactus
plants.description: Easter cactus (Hatiora gaertneri), also known as Spring cactus or Whitsun cactus, is a popular flowering plant known for its showy, tubular flowers that bloom around the Easter season. This epiphytic cactus is native to the rainforests of Brazil and is a popular houseplant due to its low-maintenance nature and attractive appearance.
plants.care_instruction: 1. Choosing the right pot Select a pot with drainage holes to prevent waterlogging. A shallow, wide pot is ideal, as Easter cactus has a shallow root system.2. Preparing the soil Use a well-draining, slightly acidic soil mix that consists of equal parts peat moss, perlite, and potting soil.3. Planting Place the plant in the center of the pot and fill the pot with the soil mixture, ensuring the roots are covered. Water the soil thoroughly and let it drain.

plants.name: Blossfeldia Cactus
plants.description: The Blossfeldia cactus, or Blossfeldia liliputana, is the smallest cactus species in the world. This tiny, slow-growing cactus is native to the high mountain regions of Argentina and Bolivia. The plant is popular among cactus enthusiasts due to its unique size and appearance. Below is a comprehensive guide to help you grow and care for your Blossfeldia cactus plant.
plants.care_instruction: Fertilization: Feed the plant with a diluted cactus fertilizer during the growing season (spring and summer). Avoid fertilizing in the winter months.Pruning: Pruning is not necessary for this slow-growing plant. However, you can remove dead or damaged growth to maintain its appearance.Pest and Disease Control: Keep an eye out for common pests such as mealybugs and spider mites. Use insecticidal soap or neem oil to treat infestations. Ensure proper watering practices to avoid root rot and other diseases.Repotting: Repot the plant every 2-3 years or when it outgrows its current pot. Use a well-draining soil mix and a pot with drainage holes to prevent waterlogging.

plants.name: Peruvian Apple Cactus
plants.description: Cereus Peruvianus Paolina, also known as Peruvian Apple Cactus or Night-blooming Cereus, is a fast-growing columnar cactus native to South America. This plant is characterized by its ribbed, spiny columns, large nocturnal blooms, and edible fruit. It can make a stunning addition to any cactus garden, landscape, or indoor plant collection.
plants.care_instruction: Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and encourage branching.Pest control: Monitor for mealybugs, scale insects, and spider mites.Winter protection: Move indoors or provide frost protection in colder climates

plants.name: Naked Lady
plants.description:
Origin - Africa
- Quite popular in europe and the usa as an indoor plant
- Forming tree to 10 m high, branches cylindrical and pencil thick, glossy green and bursting with poisonous milk, narrow deciduous leaves.
- Branches are cut and hung in rooms to avoid irritating flies in summer
plants.care_instruction:
It is planted as barriers or boundary fences.
- Will grow in any soil.
- Extremely hardy.

plants.name: Bunny Ears Catctus
plants.description: The Bunny Ear Cactus, also known as the Opuntia Microdasys, is a type of succulent plant native to Mexico. This plant gets its name from its appearance, which resembles tiny rabbit ears. They are low-maintenance and perfect for individuals who are new to gardening and succulent care.
plants.water_requirement: Watering should be done sparingly, about once a week
plants.care_instruction: Bunny Ear Cacti are very low maintenance plants, making them perfect for people who are new to succulent care. Watering should be done sparingly, about once a week, and only when the soil is completely dry. It is also important to not over-water, as this can cause root rot. In terms of fertilizer, they only need to be fed once a month during the growing season

plants.name: Dwarf Aloe Plant
plants.description: Haworthia is a type of succulent plant that belongs to the Asphodelaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is known for its rosette-shaped leaves that have a translucent, window-like appearance. The plant is small in size and has a slow growth rate, making it ideal for indoor and outdoor cultivation in pots or containers.
plants.care_instruction: Haworthia is a low-maintenance plant and does not require much care. It is important to water the plant regularly, but be careful not to over-water it, as this can lead to root rot. The soil should be allowed to dry out between waterings. Haworthia does not require regular fertilization, but a light application of fertilizer once a month during the growing season can be beneficial.

plants.name: Croton Fire Wire
plants.description: This is an interesting and colorful croton variety.The leaves are log wirey and colorful.Crotons are the kings of colorful foliage in the tropical world.They are so colorful - that their not having showy flowers is not even noticed!Potted plants are very popularly used for keeping indoors. They are not permanant indoor plants. They are used more for spot decoration or temporary use.A Polynesian variety of drooping habit, with very long, narrow-linear recurving leaves to 45 cm or more long, deep green with yellow ribs when young, changing to olive with age, the yellow becomes crimson in sunlight.
plants.water_requirement: Normal, Can tolerate less, Can tolerate more
plants.care_instruction: - Crotons can be grown in pots or the ground.Sandy well drained mix is essential.Potting mixture should not contain too much nitrogen.Composition of soil, nutrition and moisture in the growing media also have effect on growth and foliage color.They prefer warm and humid climate.In mild climate they can tolerate sun for a longer period.Moderate temperatures and bright light and high humidity are good environmental conditions for growing crotons.

plants.name: Dwarf Schefflera
plants.description: A standard indoor plant with pretty shining and palm like leaves.Easy to maintain.A well shaped, freely branched plant.Leaves palmate, glossy green, arranged in a circle of 7-8, soft leathery obovate leaflets.Grow in pots, on moss sticks (it does not stick to the moss stick), in large tubs or the ground.
plants.light_requirement: Sun growing, Semi shade, Shade growing, Low light tolerant
plants.water_requirement: Normal, Can tolerate less, Can tolerate more
plants.care_instruction: These plant tolerate low temperture of the subtropics as well as the high temperatues of the tropics.They prefer warm and dry location.Regular watering and feeding are needed at the time of its growing season from March to September.Plants will grow very well in full sunlight in coastal areas and areas with mild summers. In hot and dry areas they are best grown in semi shade to shade.Any well drained and fertile soils will do.

plants.name: Mophead Hydrangea
plants.description: What we recognize as hydrangea flowers are actually sepals. (like in ixoras, poinsettia, bougainvillea etc) sepals are long lasting.The hydrangea is a very showy medium compact deciduous shrub.Flowers heads are very attractive.Flowers spread like a sheet all around the top and the sides and seem to smother the leaves.Very popular all over the world as a indoor as well as garden plant.The color of the flower indicates soil pH. Acidic soils make the color pink and alkaline soils make the color pink.
plants.care_instruction: - Hydrangeas can take full sunlight in mild climates. In areas with very hot and dry summers - it is advisable to protect them from harsh afternoon sunlight.Plants require good fertile, well drained soil with a lot of organic matter in it.Water regularly - expecially in summer.Can be grown in pots as well as ground

plants.name: Rose
plants.description: Roses are beautiful flowering plants known for their variety of colors and fragrances.
plants.care_instruction:
1. Place the rose plant in a location with at least 6 hours of direct sunlight.
2. Water the plant regularly, keeping the soil evenly moist but not waterlogged.
3. Prune the rose plant in early spring to remove dead or damaged branches.
4. Fertilize the plant every month during the growing season.
5. Protect the plant from extreme temperatures and strong winds.

plants.name: Ananas Variegated Spineless
plants.description: Thornless Variegated Pineapple (Ananas comosus 'Variegatus') is a beautiful, ornamental pineapple plant that features attractive foliage and fruit without the characteristic sharp thorns. This tropical plant is perfect for adding a touch of the exotic to your garden or as a unique houseplant
plants.care_instruction: 1. Location Choose a well-lit area with bright, indirect sunlight. The plant thrives in warm temperatures between 65-90°F (18-32°C) and prefers high humidity.Soil Plant your pineapple in well-draining, slightly acidic soil with a pH of 5.5-6.5. You can use a mix of equal parts perlite, peat moss, and potting soil.Planting Place the plant in a pot or garden bed, ensuring the roots are well-covered with soil. If planting in a container, choose a pot with drainage holes and at least 12 inches (30 cm) in diameter

plants.name: Aucuba Croton
plants.description: Aucuba japonica 'Crotonifolia' is a popular evergreen shrub that is native to Japan. It is a compact shrub with a slow growth habit and can reach a height of 2-4 meters. This plant is also commonly known as spotted laurel, Japanese laurel, or gold dust plant.The leaves of Aucuba japonica 'Crotonifolia' are large, glossy, and dark green with yellow splotches. They are also leathery and ovate in shape, giving the plant a lush and tropical look. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, but they are followed by bright red berries that are an attractive addition to the shrub.
plants.care_instruction: Aucuba japonica 'Crotonifolia' does not require frequent pruning, but can be trimmed if necessary to maintain its shape. It is also recommended to mulch around the base of the plant to retain moisture in the soil and suppress weeds. This plant is relatively low-maintenance and is resistant to pests and diseases.

plants.name: Ajuga Variegata
plants.description: A native of Europe and Britain. Leaves 2-3 inches. Plants grow to 20 cm tall. This variety as brighter more colorful pink tinged foliage. It is an exfermely popular ground cover in Europe. Grows very well with us too. Forms a compact pyramidal mound. Blue & fainty purplish flower in spring, early summer.
plants.light_requirement: Sun growing, Semi shade, Shade growing
plants.care_instruction: Plants are very quick growing. They require well drined soil. Soil should be kept moist but not soggy. Plants can be planted in semi shade as a ground cover. Plant 15 to 20 cms apart to get uniform coverage.Increase by division or seed.

plants.name: Walking Maidenhair Fern
plants.description: Adiantum capillus-veneris, commonly known as Maidenhair fern, is a delicate and graceful fern native to the Americas and the West Indies. This fern is prized for its delicate, airy foliage, which forms lacy, dark green fronds that grow up to 1 foot tall. The name “capillus-veneris” means “venerable hair,” which is a reference to the fern's delicate, hair-like fronds.
plants.care_instruction: Maidenhair ferns require consistent moisture, and should be kept consistently moist, but not wet. If the soil becomes too dry, the fronds will turn yellow and eventually die. They should be fertilized once a month with a balanced, water-soluble fertilizer, and their potting mix should be changed once a year.

plants.name: Croton Petra, Norma
plants.description: Petra Croton Plant, also known as Codiaeum variegatum 'Petra,' is a popular houseplant known for its beautiful, multi-colored leaves. This plant is native to the Pacific Islands and Malaysia and is grown for its attractive foliage. Here is a full guide on growing, care, and benefits of the Petra Croton Plant:
plants.light_requirement: requires bright, indirect light to grow well.
plants.water_requirement: Water the plant regularly, keeping the soil moist but not waterlogged
plants.care_instruction: Pruning: Petra Croton Plant requires regular pruning to maintain its shape and encourage new growth. Use clean, sharp scissors to remove any dead or damaged leaves and stems.Humidity: Petra Croton Plant requires high humidity to thrive. You can increase humidity by placing a tray of water near the plant or by using a humidifier.Pest Control: This plant is prone to mealybugs, spider mites, and scale insects. Inspect the plant regularly for signs of infestation and treat with insecticidal soap or neem oil.Propagation: Petra Croton Plant can be propagated by stem cuttings. Take a 4-6 inch cutting from the tip of a healthy stem and root it in moist potting soil. Cover the cutting with a plastic bag to maintain high humidity.

plants.name: Croton Duck Foot
plants.description: Croton Duck Foot, also known as Codiaeum variegatum 'Duck Foot,' is a popular, vibrant, and colorful houseplant known for its distinct duck foot-shaped leaves. This comprehensive guide will provide you with all the information you need to grow, care for, and enjoy the benefits of your Croton Duck Foot plant.
plants.care_instruction: Watering: Water when the top 1-2 inches of soil feels dry. Reduce watering in winter.Fertilization: Apply a balanced, liquid fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.Pruning: Prune in early spring to maintain the desired shape and promote bushy growth.Pest Control: Inspect regularly for pests like spider mites, mealybugs, and scale insects. Use insecticidal soap or neem oil to treat infestations.Leaf Care: Wipe the leaves with a damp cloth to remove dust and maintain vibrant colors.

plants.name: Dracaena Ctc Pink Hybrid
plants.description: Cordyline Ctc Pink, also known as Cordyline fruticosa 'Pink Champion,' is an attractive, tropical, evergreen plant known for its vibrant pink and green foliage. This plant is native to Southeast Asia, Australia, and the Pacific Islands, and is a popular choice for gardens and indoor spaces due to its low-maintenance requirements and striking appearance.
plants.water_requirement: Water the plant regularly, keeping the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
plants.care_instruction: Pruning: Prune the plant in early spring or late winter to maintain its shape and size. Remove dead or damaged leaves as needed.Pests and Diseases: Cordyline Ctc Pink is relatively pest-resistant. Watch for common pests like spider mites, mealybugs, and scale insects. Treat infestations with insecticidal soap or neem oil.Temperature: This plant thrives in temperatures between 60-85°F (15-29°C). Protect it from frost and cold drafts, as it is not frost-tolerant.

plants.name: Elephant Ears
plants.description: Normal, Can tolerate more
plants.care_instruction: Grows best in soil mixed with a minimum of 50 percent organic matter. Prefer a moist and shady situation. It grows well in porous soil, rich in organic matter, perfect drainage is absolutely necessary. Propagated by the division of rhizome, suckers and more recently tissue culture.

plants.name: Clusia Variegata
plants.description: Clusia rosea variegata, also known as the Variegated Clusia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Clusiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, and is known for its ornamental leaves, which are variegated with white or yellow. The plant is an evergreen, and can be grown as a small tree or a large shrub. It can be propagated by stem cuttings, and prefers a warm, humid environment with bright, indirect light. It can also grow well indoors as a houseplant, but needs bright light and high humidity. The plant is not tolerant of frost and will not survive in temperatures below 40°F (4°C).
plants.light_requirement: Sun growing, Semi shade, Shade growing
plants.care_instruction: Light: The plant prefers bright, indirect light, but can tolerate some direct sunlight. If grown indoors, it should be placed near a sunny window or under grow lights.Temperature and humidity: The plant prefers warm temperatures, ideally between 60 and 90 degrees Fahrenheit (15-32 degrees Celsius), and high humidity. If grown indoors, it can be helpful to use a humidifier or place the plant on a tray filled with water and pebbles.Watering: Keep the soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged. The plant is sensitive to dryness and water stress. Avoid letting the soil dry out completely and wait for the top inch of soil dry before watering again.

plants.name: Clusia Marginata
plants.description: Clusia rosea 'Marginata' is a cultivar of the Clusia rosea species, which is also known as the 'Princess Flower' or 'Autograph Tree.' It is native to the Caribbean and Florida and is a type of succulent shrub. The leaves of the 'Marginata' cultivar have a distinctive yellow margin or edge, which gives the plant its name. It can grow to be several feet tall and wide and is often used as a hedge or a stand-alone specimen plant in outdoor landscapes. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-draining soil. It's also possible to grown this plant indoor, it's a easy care houseplant that have a air purifying properties and can thrive in low light.
plants.care_instruction: Light: It prefers full sun to partial shade, but can tolerate low light conditions if grown as indoor plant.Water: Water the plant regularly, but allow the soil to dry out slightly before watering again. Avoid over-watering, as this can cause the roots to rot.Soil: Grow it in well-draining soil, and consider mixing in some perlite or coarse sand to improve drainage.Fertilizer: Feed it with a balanced fertilizer during growing season.Temperature: It prefers warm temperatures, but can tolerate temperatures down to about 50 degrees Fahrenheit.
